entry.title: Demonstrators block roads to protest planned border demarcation

media:group.media:title: Demonstrators block roads to protest planned border demarcation
media:group.media:description:
Controversy is raging over the Armenian governmentโs agreement with Azerbaijan to demarcate parts of the border which critics call a unilateral withdrawal from territory by Armenia. Residents of the affected area in Tavush have risen in protest, blocking vital roads and demanding a stop to the process. This CivilNet special report breaks down what you need to know about this developing story.

media:group.media:description:
Depuis le 19 avril dernier, certaines routes du Tavush, dans le nord-est de l'Armรฉnie, sont bloquรฉes. Les habitants des villages de Kirants, Baghanis et Voskepar se sont postรฉs sur des tronรงons de route reliant leurs communautรฉs aux villes d'Ijevan et de Noyemberian. L'Armรฉnie a acceptรฉ de restituer ร l'Azerbaรฏdjan les quatre villages frontaliers abandonnรฉs qu'elle contrรดle depuis le dรฉbut des annรฉes 1990, comme premiรจre รฉtape dans la dรฉfinition de la frontiรจre entre les deux nations du Caucase du Sud.

entry.title: Inside CFTJโs demand for Azerbaijan to be investigated for genocide

media:group.media:title: Inside CFTJโs demand for Azerbaijan to be investigated for genocide
media:group.media:description:
The Center for Truth and Justice, a U.S.-based nonprofit, formally asked the International Criminal Court to investigate Azerbaijanโs leaders for genocide last week, marking the first such petition to the tribunal since Armenia joined earlier this year.
CivilNetโs Mark Dovich traveled to The Hague, Netherlands, to observe the proceedings and hear firsthand from the CFTJ team about their groundbreaking work.

media:group.media:title: Concessions In Tavush
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet Podcast, host Patrick Elliott discusses the recent changes in Armenia with guest Eric Hacopian. They unpack the border delimitation agreement with Azerbaijan starting in Tavush, followed by the landmark International Criminal Court case against Azerbaijan. They finish on the ongoing hunger strike by Ruben Vardanyan from his prison cell in Baku.

ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีถีกีญีกีฟีฅีฝีธึีด ีง ีกีฏีกีคีฅีดีซีกีฏีกีถ ึีกีฒีกึ ีฏีกีผีธึึีฅีฌึ ิธีฝีฟ ีถีกีญีกีฃีฎีซี ีกีฏีกีคีฅีดีซีกีฏีกีถ ึีกีฒีกึีจ ีฟีฅีฒีกีฏีกีตีพีฅีฌีธึ ีง ิตึึีกีถีซ 17-ึีค ีฉีกีฒีกีดีกีฝีซีถ ีฐีกึีธีฒ ีฟีกึีกีฎึีธึีดึ ิฑีตีถ ีขีกีฒีฏีกึีกีฎ ีง ีฌีซีถีฅีฌีธึ ีนีธึีฝ ีกีฏีกีคีฅีดีซีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีฌีกีฝีฟีฅึีถีฅึีซึ, ีธึีธีถึีซึ ีดีฅีฏีจ ีฌีซีถีฅีฌีธึ ีง ีกึีพีฅีฝีฟีถีฅึีซ ีฏีฌีกีฝีฟีฅึีจึ ิตึึีกีถีซ ีฏีฅีถีฟึีธีถีซึ ีขีธึีฐีฅึีจ ีฟีฅีฒีกึีธีญีพีฅีฌีธึ ีฅีถ ีกีฏีกีคีฅีดีซีกีฏีกีถ ึีกีฒีกึึ
ีีึีถ ีง ิฟีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีตีซ ีคีซึึีธึีธีทีธึีดีจ, ึ ีกึีคีตีธีึ ิฟีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีถ ีบีกีฟึีกีฝีฟ ีง ีฐีกีดีกีฃีธึีฎีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถ, ีฅีฉีฅ ีฃีกีฒีกึีกึีจ ีซ ีพีฅึีปีธ ีซึีกีฏีกีถีกีถีกึ ิฑีตีฝ ีดีกีฝีซีถ ีบีกีฟีดีธึีด ีง ิตึึีกีถีซ ิฟีธีดีซีฟีกีฝีซ ีกีถีพีกีถ ีบีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีตีซ ีผีฅีฏีฟีธึ ีีธีถีก ีีธีพีฐีกีถีถีซีฝีตีกีถีจึ
00:00 ีีถีถีกึีฏีธึีดีถีฅึ ิฟิณีี-ีซ ีฐีฅีฟ 01:37 ิปีถีนีธีึ ีฟีฅีฒีกึีธีญีฅีฌ, ึ ีซีีถีน ีง ีกีผีกีปีกึีฏีธึีด ิฟีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีถ 5:12 ิฟีกีดีบีธึีฝีกีตีซีถ ีดีฉีถีธีฌีธึีฟ 8:50 ิฑีบีกีฟีฅีฒีฅีฏีกีฟีพีธึีฉีตีธึีถ, ีดีกีดีธึีฌ, ีทึีปีกีถีกีผีพีธีฒ ีฌีธึึีฅึ 13:46 ิฟีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีถ ีดีซีกีฑีกีตีถ ีง 14:22 ิตีถีฉีกีฏีกีผีธึึีพีกีฎึีถีฅึ, ีฏีกีบีจ ึีกีฒีกึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ 15:42 ิตึีข ีฐีฅึีฉีจ ีฐีกีฝีกีพ ิฟีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีตีซีถ 16:56 ีีฅีฆ ีดีฅีฒีกีคึีธึีด ีฅีถ ีฐีธึีฆีกีฏีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีดีฅีป 20:57 ิฟีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีตีซ ีตีธึึีกีฐีกีฟีฏีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ 22:40 ิณีธึีฎีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีกึีพีฅีฝีฟีซ ิฒีีี-ีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ 24:41 ิฟีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีถ ีฐีซีดีถีกีถีธึีธีฃีพีธึีด ีง 24:59 ิปีีถีน ีฏีฌีซีถีซ, ีฅีฉีฅ ิฟีธีถีฝีฅึีพีกีฟีธึีซีกีถ ีฟีฅีฒีกึีธีญีพีซ

entry.title: Azerbaijan destroys historic Armenian church in Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan destroys historic Armenian church in Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
๐ Azerbaijan and Armenia have agreed upon sections of border in the northeastern Tavush region. ๐ The International Criminal Court is formally requested to investigate Azerbaijanโs leaders for genocide by the Center for Truth and Justice. ๐ Armeniaโs Foreign Ministry denied rumors spread by Azerbaijan that military agreements were reached at the April 5th Armenia-EU-US Brussels summit. ๐ The historic Kanach Zham Church in Shushi, Nagorno-Karabakh, has been destroyed by Azerbaijan, per Caucasus Heritage Watch.
